column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Certainly a surprisingly elite art museum. The building itself is beautiful and clean
column2: not to mention a staple attraction to Chicago itself
column3: and all the art is perfectly and tastefully displayed. The special exhibits are always fascinating and top tier (we're here for the "Van Gogh's Bedrooms" exhibit now). The staff & security are also generally friendly and very helpful. If you're in Chicago this museum is a must.
